questions.text: Which one of the following pressures is maintained by Carotid sinus baroreceptor:

A 45-year-old male with a 20-year history of alcohol use presents to the emergency department after experiencing an episode characterized by sudden muscle contractions, a brief period of unconsciousness, and involuntary jerking movements. According to his family, he stopped drinking alcohol two days ago. On examination, the patient is found to have hepatomegaly, blood pressure of 160/95 mm Hg, a heart rate of 110/min, and a temperature of 100.2°F. What is the next best step in the treatment of this patient?

Four days after undergoing laparotomy for duodenal ulcer perforation, patient is started on clear liquids. He complains of epigastric discomfort and bilious vomiting. Abdominal examination reveals generalized distension without tenderness. All of these will be done next in management except:

options.label: A
options.text: Stop orals and insert NG tube

options.label: B
options.text: Stop orals and feed via NJ tube

questions.correct_answer: B. Stop orals and feed via NJ tube

questions.text: In which of the given cases is this procedure usually performed?
questions.correct_answer: C. BCT in node negative patients
questions.explanation: Ans. C. BCT in node negative patients

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding the use of cocaine as a local anesthetic?

options.label: A
options.text: It is an amide local anesthetic metabolized in the liver

options.label: B
options.text: It is less effective than lidocaine for local anesthesia

options.label: C
options.text: It has vasoconstrictive properties that help to reduce bleeding at the site of administration

options.label: D
options.text: It does not require a prescription for use in medical settings

questions.correct_answer: C. It has vasoconstrictive properties that help to reduce bleeding at the site of administration
questions.explanation: Ans. C. It has vasoconstrictive properties that help to reduce bleeding at the site of administration

questions.text: Identify the incorrect statement regarding Herpes zoster (Shingles)?

options.label: A
options.text: Varicella-zoster virus remains dormant in Dorsal root ganglion

options.label: C
options.text: Post-herpetic neuralgia is most frequent when the trigeminal nerve is involved

options.label: D
options.text: Mucous membranes within the affected dermatomes are involved

questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Maculopapular rash is seen

questions.explanation: Ans. B. Staghorn calculi of the kidneys

questions.text: A female patient presents with a breast abscess. USG revealed abscess cavity of 40 cc volume and 4 cm in diameter. What will be your next step in management?

options.label: D
options.text: Incision and drainage under general anaesthesia

questions.text: Identify the device used in laparoscopic surgery in the image?

A 60-year-old patient with a history of hypertension and diabetes mellitus presents for a routine dental procedure. The dentist administers lidocaine with epinephrine for local anesthesia. During the procedure, the patient becomes confused and agitated, and then has a tonic-clonic seizure. The healthcare provider immediately stops the procedure and recognizes the signs of local anesthetic systemic toxicity (LAST). The patient is managed with supportive care, including administration of intravenous lipid emulsion therapy, and the seizure is controlled with benzodiazepines. The patient recovers without any further complications. Which of the following is a common clinical presentation of LAST?

A 42-year-old woman presents with vaginal spotting. She has not had a period for 2 months and her UPT is positive. What is the minimum mean sac diameter measurement necessary to diagnose an anembryonic pregnancy with certainty?
What is the impression based on the ECG given below?
A 23y primigravida presents for induction of labor at 41 weeks. Her Bishop score is 3. You proceed with cervical ripening using the agent shown below. What group of drugs does this belong to?

A 35-year-old healthy male is presented with a gunshot wound to right upper thigh region. On examination, patient was hemodynamically stable but had no palpable lower extremity pulses on the injured side. On exploration, superficial femoral artery was transected. Which of the following is the suture material to be used for vascular repair?

A 65-year-old male with a history of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) is admitted to the hospital with worsening dyspnea. The healthcare provider orders oxygen therapy to improve the patient's oxygen saturation. The respiratory therapist explains the different oxygen delivery devices available and their respective Fio2 levels and suggests to use a device which looks like in the image below. Identify the maximum Fio2 given by this device?

A 45-year-old patient presented with Erythema & purplish tinge on upper eyelids & Erythema over shawl area as shown in the image below. She also had significantly elevated serum Creatinine phosphokinase levels. Identify the false statement regarding this disease?

options.label: A
options.text: Dilated capillary loops in nail fold can be seen

options.label: B
options.text: Heliotrope rash seen in this disease is associated with anti-Mi-2 antibodies.

options.label: C
options.text: Mechanic's hands can be seen in this disease

options.label: D
options.text: Muscle tenderness is common in this condition

questions.correct_answer: D. Muscle tenderness is common in this condition
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Muscle tenderness is common in this condition

questions.text: A 40y multigravida presents at 12 weeks for a 1 st trimester ultrasound evaluation. The nuchal translucency is measured as shown in the image. She subsequently undergoes a chorionic villous sampling and the fetal karyotype is normal. Her fetus still needs to be evaluated in the 2 nd trimester for which of the following?

A 3 days old baby’s mother came to the paediatric OPD. She is concerned that whenever she breast feeds her baby, her baby sleeps comfortably but after every 30 minutes the baby wakes up and starts crying. On further evaluation, you find that the mother has been breastfeeding the baby correctly, however the baby feeds for just 5-10 minutes after which he goes to sleep. What could be the possible cause of frequent awakening in the baby?

options.label: A
options.text: Baby is crying because the diaper is wet

options.label: B
options.text: The quality of the mother’s feed is not good

options.label: C
options.text: Baby is getting only foremilk, the satiety value is missing

options.label: D
options.text: We should rule out neonatal sepsis

questions.correct_answer: C. Baby is getting only foremilk, the satiety value is missing
questions.explanation: Ans. C. baby is getting only foremilk, the satiety value is missing

options.label: C

questions.explanation: Ans. C. Receiving the varicella vaccine is an indication for pregnancy termination

questions.text: A 56 years old male presents to the emergency with abdominal pain and an episode of binge drinking in shock with a BP of 70/50 mm Hg and HR of 115/min. The oxygen saturation of the patient is 89%. Serum creatinine level was 2.4 mg/dL. What is the likely diagnosis based on the CT image shown below?

Despite this the patient continued to bleed. The following procedure was done as shown. Which haemostatic surgical procedure is shown?

A 45-year-old man with a history of peptic ulcer disease presents to the emergency department with acute abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting. He reports a recent history of non-compliance with his prescribed proton pump inhibitor medication. On examination, he appears pale and has a rigid abdomen with rebound tenderness. CXR of the patient is shown in the image below. What is the next best step in the management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Admit the patient to the ward and observe

options.label: D

In the above patient, degenerative features will be seen in which part of the spinal cord as marked in the image below?

Find the true statements on Rinne tuning fork test? Positive means patient is having sensorineural hearing loss Negative means conductive deafness Bone conduction (BC) is more than air conduction in case of conductive loss Positive means there is no hearing loss Air conduction (AC) is more than bone conduction in case of conductive loss

A 32-year-old white man with a history of type-1 diabetes presents to you complaining of decreased vision. He has not seen an ophthalmologist in years. On examination, you find numerous areas of abnormal vasculature in the retina as shown in the picture below. Pan-retinal photocoagulation might be done in this patient to:

options.label: A
options.text: Kill areas of peripheral ischemic retina

questions.correct_answer: A. Kill areas of peripheral ischemic retina
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Kill areas of peripheral ischemic retina

questions.text: A 45-year old woman presents with progressive palmoplantar, nose & pinna pigmentation. Urine sample collected for benedicts test changes to black in the supernatant and the test gives greenish brown precipitate. What is the diagnosis?
Functional residual capacity is:

options.label: B
options.text: Inspiratory reserve volume + Tidal volume + Expiratory reserve volume

questions.correct_answer: C. Expiratory reserve volume + residual volume

questions.text: ​ Various neurotransmitters are produced in the brain at different sites. Deficiency in synthesis of a particular neurotransmitter leads to ‘Paralytic agitans’. This particular neurotransmitter is produced in which of the sites marked below? ​​​​​​​

A 56-year-old woman has been diagnosed with stage IV melanoma and is scheduled to receive immune checkpoint inhibitor therapy. The physician explains the mechanism of action and potential side effects of immune checkpoint inhibitors to the patient and her family. Which of the following is true about immune checkpoint inhibitors?

options.label: A
options.text: Nivolumab works by blocking the PD-1 receptor and is used to treat various types of cancer

options.label: B
options.text: Bevacizumab works by inhibiting angiogenesis and is used to treat solid tumors

options.label: C
options.text: Rituximab works by depleting B cells and is used to treat lymphoma and autoimmune disorders

options.label: D
options.text: Trastuzumab works by targeting the HER2 receptor and is used to treat breast cancer

questions.correct_answer: A. Nivolumab works by blocking the PD-1 receptor and is used to treat various types of cancer
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Nivolumab works by blocking the PD-1 receptor and is used to treat various types of cancer.

questions.text: The base sequence of the strand of DNA used as the template for transcription has the base sequence GATCTAC. What is the base sequence of RNA product?
Fetal hemoglobin has higher affinity for oxygen due to:

options.label: D
options.text: Oxygen dissociation curve is shifted to right

questions.text: A 7 months old baby was diagnosed with urea cycle disorder. Past H/O same disease in the previous baby and died at 1-year of age. Now, what could be the rationale for feeding benzoic acids to subjects with a urea cycle enzyme defect?

options.label: A
options.text: It provides an alternative route for N2 excretion through glycine conjugate, hippuric acid

options.label: B
options.text: It provides an alternative route for N2 excretion through the N-acetyl glucuronic acid conjugate kynurenine

options.label: D
options.text: It neutralized NH3 in both blood as well as urine

questions.correct_answer: A. It provides an alternative route for N2 excretion through glycine conjugate, hippuric acid

questions.text: Identify the type of air cell shown in the picture (marked with white arrow):

A Cohort study is undertaken to study association between Green tea intake and Diabetes mellitus. Relative risk was found to be ‘0.85’. Which of the following is correct regarding association between green tea and Diabetes Mellitus (DM)?

options.label: A
options.text: ​​​​​​ Green tea consumption increases the risk of DM

options.label: B
options.text: ​​​​​​ Green tea consumption decreases the risk of DM

options.label: C
options.text: ​​​​​​ Green tea consumption has no effect on the risk of DM

questions.correct_answer: B. ​​​​​​ Green tea consumption decreases the risk of DM
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Green tea consumption decreases the risk of DM

questions.text: A neonatal examination was done in a newborn girl baby. O/E, baby has blue eyes, blonde hair and fair skin. Test result shows positive Guthrie test. All are true except:

options.label: C
options.text: ​​​​​​ White patch of hair due to tryptophan

questions.correct_answer: C. ​​​​​​ White patch of hair due to tryptophan
questions.explanation: Ans. C. White patch of hair due to tryptophan

questions.text: ​​​​​ Out of the parts of the scapula marked in the image below, which structure is palpated in the deltopectoral groove?

​​​ A 60-year-old man presents to his physician with complaints of erectile dysfunction. The physician prescribes sildenafil, a medication commonly used for the treatment of erectile dysfunction. The physician explains to the patient that sildenafil works by inhibiting an enzyme in the body. Which of the following statements best describes the mechanism of action of sildenafil?

options.label: A
options.text: Sildenafil works by blocking alpha receptors in the penile tissue, leading to vasodilation and increased blood flow to the penis

options.label: B
options.text: Sildenafil works by inhibiting phosphodiesterase type 5 (PDE5), leading to increased levels of cyclic guanosine monophosphate (cGMP) and smooth muscle relaxation in the penile tissue

options.label: C
options.text: Sildenafil works by blocking the action of testosterone, leading to decreased libido and improved erectile function

options.label: D
options.text: Sildenafil works by stimulating the production of nitric oxide, leading to increased blood flow to the penis

questions.correct_answer: B. Sildenafil works by inhibiting phosphodiesterase type 5 (PDE5), leading to increased levels of cyclic guanosine monophosphate (cGMP) and smooth muscle relaxation in the penile tissue
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Sildenafil works by inhibiting phosphodiesterase type 5 (PDE5), leading to increased levels of cyclic guanosine monophosphate (cGMP) and smooth muscle relaxation in the penile tissue

questions.text: ​​​ Which among the following is a category A bioterrorism agent?

An elderly patient with atherosclerotic heart disease has increasing lethargy for the past 5 years. On examination, his blood pressure is 158/108 mm Hg. Laboratory studies show serum creatinine 5.8 mg/dL and urea nitrogen 60 mg/dL. He has the microscopic appearance in his kidneys seen here. Which of the following findings on urinalysis is most specific for the underlying disease leading to this appearance?
See the Image given and identify the journey of country from Stage 1 through Stage 4?

A 20-year-old individual goes to his physician for a routine check-up. The physical examination is normal except that his stool is positive for occult blood. A colonoscopy is performed and there are over 100 lesions of the colonic mucosa and biopsy of one shows findings seen here microscopically. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
Which vaccine strain changes annually?
Which of the following is NOT a correct match of symptoms and action of antidepressants and the receptors involved?

options.label: A
options.text: Sedation and weight gain - H1 receptor blockade

options.label: B
options.text: Dry mouth and constipation - Muscarinic receptor blockade

options.label: C
options.text: Sexual dysfunction and anorgasmia - 5HT reuptake inhibition

questions.text: Which of the following is not a correct match with respect to the mechanism of action and clinical use of the given drugs?

options.label: A
options.text: Zavegepant - CGRP receptor antagonist used for the treatment of acute migraine attacks

options.label: B
options.text: Sparsentan - Dual endothelin and angiotensin receptor antagonist used for the treatment of CHF ​​​​​​​

options.label: C
options.text: Lenacapavir - HIV-1 capsid inhibitor used for the treatment of HIV infection ​​​​​​​

options.label: D
options.text: Teplizumab - Anti-CD3 monoclonal antibody used for the prevention of type 1 diabetes in high-risk individuals

questions.correct_answer: B. Sparsentan - Dual endothelin and angiotensin receptor antagonist used for the treatment of CHF ​​​​​​​
questions.explanation: Ans. B. Sparsentan - Dual endothelin and angiotensin receptor antagonist used for the treatment of CHF

questions.text: A 42-year-old woman with chronic hypertension is prescribed a new medication by her physician. The medication is available in two forms, an oral tablet and an intravenous (IV) injection. The physician explains to the patient that the IV injection has 100% bioavailability, while the oral tablet has a bioavailability of only 60%. The patient is concerned about the cost of the medication and asks if the oral tablet can be used instead of the IV injection. Which of the following statements is most accurate regarding the use of the oral tablet versus the IV injection in terms of bioavailability?

options.label: A
options.text: The IV injection should be used instead of the oral tablet because it has higher bioavailability

options.label: B
options.text: The oral tablet should be used instead of the IV injection because it is less expensive and has adequate bioavailability

options.label: C
options.text: The oral tablet should be used instead of the IV injection because it has better safety and tolerability ​​​​​​​

options.label: D
options.text: The IV injection should be used instead of the oral tablet because it is more effective in lowering blood pressure

questions.correct_answer: B. The oral tablet should be used instead of the IV injection because it is less expensive and has adequate bioavailability
questions.explanation: Ans. B. The oral tablet should be used instead of the IV injection because it is less expensive and has adequate bioavailability

questions.text: Which of the following is the medial branch of the external carotid artery?
Which of the following fungal infection occurs most commonly due to thorn prick from a rose plant?

A 62-year-old male presents to the emergency department with chest pain and shortness of breath. The patient has a past medical history of hypertension and hyperlipidemia. An electrocardiogram (ECG) reveals ST-segment elevation. The patient is diagnosed with acute myocardial infarction (AMI) and undergoes percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI). The cardiologist orders the patient to take an antiplatelet drug after the procedure to prevent further clot formation. Which of the following best describes the mechanism of action of aspirin, a commonly used antiplatelet drug?

options.label: A
options.text: Inhibits cyclooxygenase-1 (COX-1) and decreases production of thromboxane A2, thereby reducing platelet activation and aggregation

options.label: B
options.text: Blocks the P2Y12 receptor on platelets, inhibiting the activation and aggregation of platelets

options.label: C
options.text: Inhibits the formation of fibrin by blocking the conversion of fibrinogen to fibrin

options.label: D
options.text: Binds to glycoprotein IIb/IIIa receptors on the surface of activated platelets, preventing the aggregation of platelets

questions.correct_answer: A. Inhibits cyclooxygenase-1 (COX-1) and decreases production of thromboxane A2, thereby reducing platelet activation and aggregation
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Inhibits cyclooxygenase-1 (COX-1) and decreases production of thromboxane A2, thereby reducing platelet activation and aggregation

questions.text: Which nerve is also called as ‘Eye of the hand’?
Which of the following conditions is correctly matched?

options.label: A
options.text: Mismatch repair gene defect: xeroderma pigmentosum

options.label: C
options.text: Homologous recombination repair gene defect: Fanconi anemia

options.label: D
options.text: Non homologous end joining: Wermer syndrome

questions.correct_answer: C. Homologous recombination repair gene defect: Fanconi anemia
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Homologous recombination repair gene defect: Fanconi anemia

questions.text: Rabies Immunoglobulin, true is?

options.label: D
options.text: If human IG is not present, then give equine IG

questions.correct_answer: D. If human IG is not present, then give equine IG
questions.explanation: Ans. D. If human IG is not present, then give equine IG

questions.text: A 26-year-old female presents to the emergency department after intentionally overdosing on aspirin. She reports taking approximately 30 tablets (325 mg each) over the past 12 hours. On examination, the patient is tachypneic with hyperventilation and has a metabolic acidosis. The emergency department physician orders aggressive hydration and urine alkalinization. Which of the following is the primary reason for the use of urine alkalinization in aspirin poisoning?

options.label: A
options.text: To increase urinary excretion of salicylate

options.label: B
options.text: To promote diuresis and increase renal blood flow

options.label: C
options.text: To increase the excretion of unbound salicylate

options.label: D
options.text: To counteract the acidosis caused by salicylate poisoning

questions.correct_answer: A. To increase urinary excretion of salicylate
questions.explanation: Ans. A. To increase urinary excretion of salicylate

options.label: A

options.label: B

options.label: C

questions.text: A 40-year-old woman has noted painless enlargement of her neck for the past month. On physical examination, she has diffuse, symmetrical thyroid enlargement without tenderness on palpation. Laboratory studies show her serum TSH is reduced and her thyroxine levels are elevated. Based upon this representative appearance of her thyroid gland, which of the following is the likely mechanism for the pathology of the patient?
Correct statement about Vaccine Vial Monitor is?

options.label: A
options.text: Vial is usable if inner square is lighter than outer circle

options.label: B
options.text: Vial is usable if inner square is same color as outer circle

options.label: C

questions.text: A 55-year-old male patient underwent an open Lichtenstein hernioplasty for inguinal hernia repair. Postoperatively, the patient complained of persistent pain at the surgical site, which worsened with physical activity. On examination, the surgical wound appeared well-healed, and there was no sign of infection. The patient was diagnosed with chronic pain syndrome. The patient was advised to take pain medication and to avoid strenuous physical activity. Physical therapy and nerve blocks were also recommended to manage the pain. The patient's symptoms improved gradually over time, and he was able to return to his normal activities after several weeks. Which of the following is the most common complication of inguinal hernia repair surgery?

A young female presents with complaints of bone pain and abdominal cramps. Her family gives history of abnormal behavior. Based on clinical features, which of the following will be the best investigation to arrive at a definitive diagnosis?

A 62-year-old female with a history of breast cancer presents to the clinic for a routine follow-up. The patient reports completing a course of chemotherapy that included doxorubicin. The patient now reports experiencing shortness of breath, fatigue, and palpitations. Echocardiography reveals a reduced ejection fraction of 40%. Which of the following is the most likely cause of the patient's symptoms?

A 60-year-old female patient underwent a laparoscopic cholecystectomy for gallbladder removal. Postoperatively, the patient developed symptoms of abdominal pain, fever, and jaundice. Imaging studies revealed a proximal bile duct injury. Imaging studies revealed cystic duct leak. What is the appropriate management of a patient of this patient?

options.label: C
options.text: Surgical intervention, including bile duct repair or reconstruction

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding the umbilical artery Doppler shown below?

options.label: A
options.text: This is absent end systolic flow

options.label: B
options.text: This is reversed end diastolic flow

options.label: C
options.text: This finding is normal until 32 weeks gestation

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: B. This is reversed end diastolic flow
questions.explanation: Ans. B. This is reversed end diastolic flow

questions.text: A 59-year-old woman is diagnosed with enterococcal endocarditis. She has no known drug allergies. Which of the following would reflect standard therapy?

The patient reports taking oral anti-diabetic medications, including metformin, sulfonylureas, and dipeptidyl peptidase-4 (DPP-4) inhibitors. Which of the following adverse effects is most likely associated with metformin use?

options.label: C
options.text: Gestational sac, yolk sac, fetal pole without cardiac activity

options.label: D
options.text: Gestational sac, yolk sac, fetal pole with cardiac activity

questions.explanation: Ans. D. Gestational sac, yolk sac, fetal pole with cardiac activity

questions.text: A 50-year-old woman presents to the ED with a pulsating headache and dizziness. She has been non-compliant with her blood pressure medications over the past month. She usually takes Enalapril and metoprolol. BP is 245/120 mmHg and heart rate is 88 beats per minute. She has cotton wool spots on fundus exam. What is the best treatment option among the choices listed?

A 60-year-old man Mahendra has been a cigarette smoker since his college days. He had several episodes of hemoptysis in the past two weeks along with fatigue, headache, nausea, and anorexia. A chest radiograph shows an ill-defined hilar mass and the transbronchial lung biopsy is performed. The microscopic appearance is shown. Which of the following laboratory test findings is most likely to be present in this patient?
Formula given is used to calculate:

A 10-year-old boy complains of right lower leg pain for 3 months after a fall down a flight of stairs. On physical examination, he was febrile. X-ray of the limb revealed a mass involving the right tibial diaphysis, with expansion and destruction of the overlying cortex. A biopsy of the lesion is performed, and the microscopic appearance is shown here. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 34-year-old male with a history of tuberculosis presents to the clinic with complaints of cough, fever, and night sweats. The patient reports completing a course of anti-tuberculosis medications but reports recurrent symptoms. Sputum culture reveals that the mycobacterium is resistant to isoniazid, rifampicin and levofloxacin and sensitive to other first line drugs and linezolide as well as bed aquiline. Which type of tuberculosis it can be referred to as?

A 30-year-old male patient presented with a painless mass in his right testicle. A physical exam and imaging studies revealed a solid mass in the right testis with retroperitoneal lymph node enlargement. What is the appropriate treatment for testicular cancer based on the stage of the disease?

options.label: D
options.text: Orchidectomy with retroperitoneal lymph node dissection

questions.text: Pasteurization test done for milk except?

A 23-year-old female presents with abdominal pain and vomiting approximately 5 hours of ingestion of 8g paracetamol in an apparent suicide attempt. When considering NAC in this patient, which statement is true?

options.label: A
options.text: NAC prevents renal toxicity by detoxifying NAPQI and decreasing NAPQI production

options.label: B
options.text: Nearly 30% of patients treated with IV NAC will develop anaphylactoid reactions

options.label: C
options.text: NAC crosses the placenta but is safe in pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: PO NAC is superior to IV NAC in patients presenting within 8-24 hours

questions.correct_answer: C. NAC crosses the placenta but is safe in pregnancy
questions.explanation: Ans. C. NAC crosses the placenta but is safe in pregnancy

questions.text: A female patient presents with a breast abscess. USG revealed abscess cavity of 40 cc volume and 4 cm in diameter. What will be your next step in management?

options.label: B

options.label: C

options.label: D

questions.correct_answer: A. Reactionary hemorrhage occurs 24-48 hours after surgery
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Reactionary hemorrhage occurs 24-48 hours after surgery

questions.text: ​​ A 56-year-old woman presented with gram negative sepsis from urinary tract infection and started on IV Piperacillin-Tazobactum. She had normal renal function on presentation but on day 7, she developed acute renal failure with rising creatinine. Urine testing revealed eosinophiluria. Which of the following will the gold standard test for diagnosis?
​​​ A woman comes in for an annual gynecologic examination. During speculum examination, you see the following. What is the most appropriate next step?

A 43-year-old gentleman presented with 5 weeks of progressive dyspnoea and intermittent fever. Blood reports – TLC: 18000, CRP & ESR elevated, CXR shows bilateral areas of consolidation. You started him on empirical antibiotics and the patient is not responding and repeat CXR revealed new areas of consolidation. The most likely diagnosis is that is to be confirmed is?
Which muscle is known as the ‘Key muscle of the gluteal region’?

A 28-year-old male with a history of schizophrenia was recently started on an antipsychotic medication. Over the past week, the patient has been experiencing symptoms of restlessness, including difficulty sitting still, pacing, and a strong urge to move his legs. Which of the following medications should be added to the treatment of the patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A. Propranolol

Explanation:

  • • A. Propranolol, a beta-blocker, is considered the DOC for managing akathisia.
  • • B. Lorazepam can be used for managing akathisia but is not its first line treatment.
  • • C. Benztropine is an anticholinergic agent used to treat extrapyramidal symptoms (EPS), such as dystonia and drug induced parkinsonism, which can also be side effects of antipsychotic medications. However, it is not effective for treating akathisia.
  • • D. Diphenhydramine is an antihistamine with anticholinergic properties that can be used to treat mild EPS, like drug-induced parkinsonism, but it is not the preferred choice for managing akathisia.

A tRNA molecule that is supposed to carry cysteine (tRNA cys ) is mischarged, so that it actually carries alanine (ala-tRNA cys ). Assuming no correction occurs, what will be the fate of this alanine residue during protein synthesis?

options.label: A
options.text: It will be incorporated into a protein in response to an alanine codon

options.label: B
options.text: It will be incorporated into a protein in response to a cysteine codon

options.label: C
options.text: It will remain attached to the tRNA as it cannot be used for protein synthesis

options.label: D
options.text: It will be chemically converted to cysteine by cellular-enzymes

questions.correct_answer: B. It will be incorporated into a protein in response to a cysteine codon
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. It will be incorporated into a protein in response to a cysteine codon

questions.text: Life cycle of which organism is depicted in the Image below?
What is the correct sequence of the primary survey in trauma management, as per the Advanced Trauma Life Support (ATLS) guidelines?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B. Airway, breathing, circulation, disability

Explanation:

  • • Option B: Airway, breathing, circulation, disability Explanation: This is the correct sequence of the primary survey in trauma management according to ATLS guidelines. The ABCD approach emphasizes the importance of rapid assessment and intervention to prevent morbidity and mortality in trauma patients.
  • • Option C: Airway, bleeding, consciousness, disability Explanation: This is an incorrect sequence of the primary survey in trauma management according to ATLS guidelines. The correct sequence is airway, breathing, circulation, disability (ABCD).
  • • Option D: Airway, circulation, bleeding, disability Explanation: This is an incorrect sequence of the primary survey in trauma management according to ATLS guidelines. The correct sequence is airway, breathing, circulation, disability (ABCD).

questions.text: A 24 year old G2 at 28 weeks is brought to the emergency after being found unconscious at home by her mother. Once the patient is stabilized, she undergoes cesarean delivery for fetal distress. Post-partum, the below MRI is done. What is the most likely finding on imaging?

A 55-year-old man who received a kidney transplant three months ago presents to the clinic with complaints of fever, malaise, and abdominal pain. Physical examination reveals tenderness in the right upper quadrant of the abdomen. Laboratory tests show elevated liver enzymes and a positive blood culture for cytomegalovirus. The patient's immunosuppressive regimen includes tacrolimus. Which of the following is the mechanism of action of tacrolimus that is most relevant to the management of this patient's condition?

A 28-year-old G2P1 pregnant female at 10 weeks of gestation presents with a two-week history of irritability and racing thoughts. She has been sleeping for only 2 hours per night. Recently, she got into a physical altercation with a colleague and threw her laptop at him. She has been working excessively, insisting that she wants to prove she is the "bestest employee" in the office. Her husband mentions that she has a history of similar episodes in the past but had been stable without medication for the past year. There is no history of substance abuse. What is the most appropriate intervention for this patient?

A 19-year-old female college student is diagnosed with a pelvic mass and an elevated lactate dehydrogenase level. She says that she was amenorrheic until she started taking combination oral contraceptive pills (COCs). She undergoes surgical exploration, and frozen section analysis of the surgical specimen reveals ovarian dysgerminoma. Which of the following is FALSE?

options.label: B
options.text: Regardless of stage, she has an excellent prognosis

options.label: C
options.text: Her other ovary may contain a gonadoblastoma and should be removed

options.label: D
options.text: She should undergo complete surgical staging, but her uterus may be preserved

questions.correct_answer: A. Her karyotype is most likely 46XX
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Her karyotype is most likely 46XX

questions.text: A 62-year-old woman has been diagnosed with stage III breast cancer and her physician has recommended a new experimental drug for her treatment. The physician explains the different phases of clinical trials to the patient and her family. Which of the following is false about the different phases of clinical trials?

options.label: A
options.text: Phase I trials are conducted in a small group of patients to evaluate the safety, dosage, and potential side effects of the new treatment.

options.label: B
options.text: Phase II trials are conducted in a small group of patients to evaluate its efficacy, optimal dosage, and safety.

options.label: C
options.text: Phase III trials are conducted to confirm the efficacy and safety of the new treatment compared to existing treatments or a placebo, as well as to evaluate its optimal dosage.

options.label: D
options.text: Phase IV trials are conducted after regulatory approval of the new treatment and involve monitoring its long-term safety and effectiveness in a large population.

questions.correct_answer: A. Phase I trials are conducted in a small group of patients to evaluate the safety, dosage, and potential side effects of the new treatment.
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Phase I trials are conducted in a small group of patients to evaluate the safety, dosage, and potential side effects of the new treatment.

questions.text: A 60-year-old woman undergoes a robotic assisted hysterectomy, bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, and bilateral pelvic and paraaortic lymph node dissection. Her pathology reveals a grade 2 endometrioid adenocarcinoma with greater than 50% myometrial invasion, lymphovascular space invasion (LVSI), and positive washings. All the other pathology is benign. What stage is she assigned according to International Federation of Gynecology and Obstetrics (FIGO) criteria?

35-year-old healthy male is presented with a gunshot wound to right upper thigh region. On examination, patient was hemodynamically stable but had no palpable lower extremity pulses on the injured side. On exploration - superficial femoral artery was transected. Which of the following is the suture material to be used for vascular repair?

Following a vaginal hysterectomy with anterior and posterior colporrhaphy for a 3 rd degree uterovaginal prolapse, it is observed that the vault lies just above the introitus. Which additional procedure should be done to prevent vault prolapse in the future?

A 38-year-old with infertility secondary to tubal blockage just underwent in vitro fertilization (IVF). Her peak estradiol was 4500 pg/mL. Seventeen oocytes were retrieved, and two embryos were transferred. She conceived with a singleton gestation. She developed ovarian hyperstimulation syndrome. Which of the following was a predisposing factor in developing ovarian hyperstimulation?
An 18-year-old with previously regular menses, presents with amenorrhea. She is also diagnosed with anorexia nervosa. Which of the following is likely to be seen in this patient?

A 14-year-old female presents with increasingly painful, cyclic menses since menarche 9 months ago. Oral analgesics and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory medications no longer adequately control her dysmenorrhea. Which of the following congenital anomalies is most likely present?
A 5-year-old child was diagnosed with Wilson disease. During slit lamp examination, he was found to have a Kayser Fleischer (KF) ring. How would you describe a KF ring?

options.label: A
options.text: Black discoloration at the outer margin of the cornea because of the deposition of copper in Descemet's membrane

options.label: B
options.text: Brown discoloration at the inner margin of the cornea because of the deposition of copper in Descemet's membrane ​​​​​​​

options.label: C
options.text: Brown discoloration at the outer margin of the retina because of the deposition of copper in Descemet's membrane

options.label: D
options.text: Brown discoloration at the outer margin of the cornea because of the deposition of copper in Descemet's membrane

questions.correct_answer: D. Brown discoloration at the outer margin of the cornea because of the deposition of copper in Descemet's membrane
questions.explanation: Ans. D. Brown discoloration at the outer margin of the cornea because of the deposition of copper in Descemet's membrane

questions.text: How much time does it take for the finding shown below to occur, after BCG vaccination?

A 5-year-old child presents with acute onset watery diarrhea. The mother reports that the child had 6 episodes of diarrhea in the last 24 hours. The child has no fever, abdominal pain, or vomiting. The child is alert and well hydrated. On examination, the abdomen is soft and non-tender. What is the most common infectious cause of diarrhea in children?
